data.name: Startup valuation forecast
data.description:
#Preview James just started working at a Venture Capital fund. One of the promising investments the fund is currently evaluating is a strongly growing e-commerce startup in Ireland. The team seems to be very ambitions and the market niche is great.
In order to make sure the investment will be profitable the fund wants James to create a forecast of future revenues and a potential valuation. James is currently requesting more detailed information about past revenues and investigating the appropriate multiple for the company's market niche.
Can you help him create a revenue and valuation forecast? #Problem Help James by developing a forecast of revenues the startup will reach in 5 years. Calculate the valuation with the given revenue multiple and indicate if it will potentially exceed 50 Million (the amount the fund needs to justify their investment for 10% of the company).
Past revenues will be passed on to the function as an array of revenues (in thousands) for the last 5 years and the multiple as a float in the following form: ```javascript rev = [46, 148, 576, 954, 2242] multiple = 4.3 ``` Future revenues are expected to develop linearly.
The solution is supposed to be passed as a string indicating if the revenues and valuation in year 10 will be enough (valuation of over 50 million) in the following form: ```javascript 'The revenue multiple valuation in year 10 will be below the required value at 19.06 million for 4.43 million of revenues in year 10.' ``` ##Hint Looking up the formulas for linear regression might help to forecast the revenues.
